title: Makes certain persons who are eligible for or receiving social security disability insurance benefits eligible for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage
summary: Makes certain persons (meeting certain income requirements) who are eligible for or receiving social security disability insurance (SSDI) benefits eligible for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          985

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by Sens. KLEIN, ADAMS, ADDABBO, BRESLIN, DIAZ, DILAN, DUANE,
         HASSELL-THOMPSON, HUNTLEY, KRUEGER, KRUGER, OPPENHEIMER, PARKER, SAVI-
         NO, SERRANO, SMITH, STAVISKY, VALESKY -- read twice and ordered print-
         ed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee on Aging

       AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to making certain persons who
         are eligible for or receiving  social  security  disability  insurance
         benefits eligible for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivisions 1 and 2 of section 242 of the elder law, para-
    2  graph (b) of subdivision 1 and paragraphs (a) and (b) of  subdivision  2
    3  as  amended  by  section 14 of part B of chapter 57 of the laws of 2006,
    4  are amended to read as follows:
    5    1. Persons eligible  for  comprehensive  coverage  under  section  two
    6  hundred forty-seven of this title shall include:
    7    (a) any unmarried resident who is at least sixty-five years of age, OR
    8  ELIGIBLE  FOR  OR  RECEIVING SOCIAL SECURITY DISABILITY INSURANCE (SSDI)
    9  BENEFITS, and whose income for the calendar year  immediately  preceding
   10  the  effective  date of the annual coverage period beginning on or after
   11  January first, two thousand five, is less than or equal to twenty  thou-
   12  sand  dollars.    After  the  initial determination of eligibility, each
   13  eligible individual must be redetermined eligible at least  every  twen-
   14  ty-four months; and
   15    (b)  any  married resident who is at least sixty-five years of age, OR
   16  ELIGIBLE FOR OR RECEIVING SOCIAL SECURITY  DISABILITY  INSURANCE  (SSDI)
   17  BENEFITS,  and  whose income for the calendar year immediately preceding
   18  the effective date of the annual coverage period when combined with  the
   19  income  in the same calendar year of such married person's spouse begin-
   20  ning on or after January first, two thousand one, is less than or  equal
   21  to  twenty-six  thousand  dollars.  After  the  initial determination of

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04345-01-1

       S. 985                              2

    1  eligibility, each eligible individual must be redetermined  eligible  at
    2  least every twenty-four months.
    3    2.  Persons  eligible  for  catastrophic  coverage  under  section two
    4  hundred forty-eight of this title shall include:
    5    (a) any unmarried resident who is at least sixty-five years of age, OR
    6  ELIGIBLE FOR OR RECEIVING SOCIAL SECURITY  DISABILITY  INSURANCE  (SSDI)
    7  BENEFITS,  and  whose income for the calendar year immediately preceding
    8  the effective date of the annual coverage period beginning on  or  after
    9  January  first,  two thousand one, is more than twenty thousand and less
   10  than or equal to thirty-five thousand dollars. After the initial  deter-
   11  mination  of  eligibility, each eligible individual must be redetermined
   12  eligible at least every twenty-four months; and
   13    (b) any married resident who is at least sixty-five years of  age,  OR
   14  ELIGIBLE  FOR  OR  RECEIVING SOCIAL SECURITY DISABILITY INSURANCE (SSDI)
   15  BENEFITS, and whose income for the calendar year  immediately  preceding
   16  the  effective date of the annual coverage period when combined with the
   17  income in the same calendar year of such married person's spouse  begin-
   18  ning  on  or after January first, two thousand one, is more than twenty-
   19  six thousand dollars and less than or equal to fifty  thousand  dollars.
   20  After the initial determination of eligibility, each eligible individual
   21  must be redetermined eligible at least every twenty-four months.
   22    S  2.  This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to bene-
   23  fits paid on or after such effective  date.  Effective  immediately  the
   24  executive  director  of  the  elderly  pharmaceutical insurance coverage
   25  panel may promulgate any rules and regulations necessary for the  imple-
   26  mentation of this act.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to making certain persons who are eligible for or receiving social security disability insurance benefits eligible for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage
